titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory to the Free to Choose video tape collection
Free to Choose video tape collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Natasha Porfirenko

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-01-10T16:27-0800

change.item: Created Audiovisual Materials series and subsumed old series under it, reorganized items by program # instead of format, added program titles, and clarified that some of the videorecordings are from a second version of the Free to Choose series [Sarah Patton].
Added related Milton Friedman collections and updated abstract link.
Added statement and link to digitized versions available online in abstract.

did.unittitle: Free to Choose video tape collection

physdesc.extent: 10 manuscript boxes, 10 motion picture film reels, 42 videoreels

did.abstract: Motion picture film, video tapes, and film strips of the television series Free to Choose, featuring Milton Friedman and relating to laissez-faire economics, produced in 1980 by Penn Communications and television station WQLN in Erie, Pennsylvania. Includes commercial and master film copies, unedited film, and correspondence, memoranda, and legal agreements dated from 1977 to 1987 relating to production of the series. Digitized copies of many of the sound and video recordings in this collection, as well as some of Friedman's writings, are available at http://miltonfriedman.hoover.org.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Free to Choose video tape collection, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1980, with increments received in 1988 and 1989.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Collection(s)
relatedmaterial.p: Milton Friedman papers, Hoover Institution Archives
Collected Works of Milton Friedman website, http://miltonfriedman.hoover.org
Collected Works of Milton Friedman Project records, Hoover Institution Archives
The Legacy of Milton and Rose Friedman's Free to Choose conference proceedings, 2003, Hoover Institution Archives

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Motion picture film, video tapes, and film strips of the television series Free to Choose, featuring Milton Friedman and relating to laissez-faire economics, produced in 1980 by Penn Communications and television station WQLN in Erie, Pennsylvania. Includes commercial and master film copies and unedited film, as well as project files, correspondence, memoranda, publicity materials, and legal agreements dated from 1977 to 1987 relating to production of the series.
Digitized copies of many of the sound and video recordings in this collection, as well as some of Friedman's writings, are available at http://miltonfriedman.hoover.org.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, Friedman project analysis, working schedule and responsibilities, budget, planning session, TV topics and key ideas, notes of the meetings, proposals and lecture list, and cash flow chart.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Guide to "ten stimulating television programs in which Milton Friedman, Nobel laureate, economist, and columnist, challenges us with startling facts and thought-provoking ideas, then responds to opposing views, raising brass-tack questions about the future of our free society."

did.unittitle: Instructor's resource guide to Free to Choose, a television series by Milton Friedman

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Written by John M. Allen and David G. Armstrong, Center for Education and Research in Free Enterprise, A&M University, Texas.

List of stations airing Free to Choose programs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes repeat time.

did.unittitle: Ten posters reflecting the theme of the programs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Milton Friedman Speaks was a series of 15 lectures, with question and answer sessions, given by Friedman between 1977 and 1978 that formed the basis for the Free to Choose television series. Master copies, 27 two-inch videoreels.

did.unittitle: "Who Protects the Consumer?," lecture 1, Pfizer Corporation, New York City,
"Putting Learning Back in the Classroom," lecture 2, Harlem Parents for Vouchers, New York City,
"Who Protects the Worker?", lecture 4, WQLN-TV, Erie, Pennsylvania,
"What Is America?," lecture 5, University of Chicago,
"Myths That Conceal Reality," lecture 6, Utah State University,
"Money and Inflation," lecture 7, University of San Diego/San Diego Chamber of Commerce,
"Is Tax Reform Possible?," lecture 8, Americanism Education League, Pasadena, California,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tape cut in two at 11:00 minutes.

did.unittitle: "The Role of Government in a Free Society," lecture 9, Stanford University,
"The Energy Crisis: A Humane Solution," lecture 10, Bank of America, San Francisco, California,
"What Is Wrong with the Welfare State," lecture 12, University of Rochester,
"Free Trade: Producer vs. Consumer," lecture 13, Kansas State University,
"Equality and Freedom in the Free Enterprise System," lecture 14, College of William and Mary, Newport News Campus,
"The Economics of Medical Care," lecture 15, Mayo Foundation, Rochester, Minnesota, Q&A,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Each hour-long program consists of a segment of Milton Friedman discussing free market issues in various locations worldwide, followed by a discussion between Friedman and other scholars and experts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Label on videoreel indicates that it consists of two 30-minute shows.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Label on videoreel indicates that it consists of one 30-minute show.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Three units; each unit contains three sound cassettes and three sound and color film strips that furnish the basis for a wide variety of classroom projects.

did.unittitle: Unit 1, The Line Between Freedom and Equality

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes "From Cradle to Grave," "Created Equal," and "How to Stay Free."

did.unittitle: Unit 2, The Free Market and Business Cycles

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes "The Power of the Market," "Anatomy of Crisis," and "How to Cure Inflation."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes "The Tyranny of Control," "Who Protects the Consumer?," and "Who Protects the Worker?"

did.unittitle: Free to Choose: A Second Look videorecordings,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of the original series documentary segment, followed by a half-hour question and answer session with Milton Friedman and high school students. Edit master copies, 5 one-inch videoreels.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Label: air master.
